Print String: Outputs a string to the log, generally used for logic checks and debugging In the log, this string prints whenever the logic runs successfully, regardless of whether this Node Graph is toggled
Set Local Variable: When connected to the Query Node [Get Local Variable], this overwrites the value of that Local Variable
Value used to overwrite this local variable
Break Loop: Break out of a Finite Loop. The output pin must connect to the [Break Loop] input parameter of the [Finite Loop] Node
Finite Loop: From the [Loop Start Value] to the [Loop End Value], the loop iterates, incrementing the Integer by 1 each time. On each iteration, it executes the Nodes connected to [Loop Body]. After a full iteration, it executes the Nodes connected to [Loop Complete]. Use [Break Loop] to end the iteration early. After exiting the loop, the logic connected to the [Loop Complete] node will also be executed.
Integer value at which the iteration ends
Integer value of the current execution logic
Forwarding Event: Forwards the source event of this Node's Execution Flow to the specified Target Entity. The event with the same name on the Target Entity's Node Graph will be triggered
Insert Value Into List: Insert a value at the specified ID Location in the specified List. The inserted value appears at that ID after insertion For example: Inserting 5 at ID 2 in the List [1, 2, 3, 4] results in [1, 2, 5, 3, 4] (5 appears at ID 2)
Reference to the list being inserted
ID of the inserted value (after insertion)
SetListValue: Sets the value at a specified index position in a specified list.
Remove Value From List: Remove the value at the specified ID Location from the specified List. All subsequent values shift forward by one position
Reference to the list of values to remove
List Iteration Loop: Iterate through the specified List in sequential order
List Sorting: Sort the specified List according to the chosen sort method
Integer List or Floating Point Number List
Concatenate List: Append the input List to the end of the Target List. For example, Target List [1, 2, 3] with input [4, 5] becomes [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] after execution
The input list will be added to the end of the Target list
Set Node Graph Variable: Set the value of the specified Node Graph Variable in the current Node Graph
Name of the Node Graph Variable. Must be unique within the same Node Graph
Default: True. If set to False, this Node Graph Variable editing will not trigger the Variable Change Event
Set Custom Variable: Set the value of the specified Custom Variable on the Target Entity
The variable is mounted on this entity
Custom variable name. Must be unique
Default: True. When set to False, this custom variable editing will not trigger the On Custom Variable Change event
Set Preset Status: Set the Preset Status of the specified Target Entity
Preset Status set for the entity
The unique identifier for the Preset Status
Create Entity: Create an Entity by GUID. The Entity must be pre-placed in the Scene
Determines the Unit Tags carried when this entity is created
Create Prefab: Create an Entity by Prefab ID
Determines whether the created entity belongs to another entity
When set to False, the [Level] parameter has no effect
Determines the Level when the entity is created
Determines the Unit Tags carried when this entity is created
Entities created in this way do not have a GUID
Create Prefab Group: Create the Entities contained in the Prefab Group by Prefab Group ID
Absolute Location of the Prefab Group center
Absolute Rotation of the Prefab Group center
Determines whether the entity belongs to another entity after creation
Determines the Level when the entity is created
Determines the Unit Tags carried when the entity is created
When set to False, the [Level] parameter has no effect
Entities created in this way do not have a GUID
Activate/Disable Model Display: Edit the Entity's Model Visibility attribute to make its Model visible or hidden
Set to True to make the model visible
Destroy Entity: Destroying a specified entity will result in a destruction effect and can also trigger logic that only occurs after destruction, such as end-of-life behaviors in local projectiles or the dropping of energy orbs from destroyed creations. The [When Entity Is Destroyed] and [ When Entity Is Removed/Destroyed ] events can be monitored on Stage Entities
Remove Entity: Removing a specified entity is different from destroying it; there will be no destruction effect, and it will not trigger any logic that would occur after destruction, such as end-of-life behaviors in local projectiles or the dropping of energy orbs from removed creations. Removing an Entity does not trigger the [On Entity Destroyed] event, but it can trigger the [On Entity Removed/Destroyed] event
Settle Stage: Triggers the Stage Settlement process, which executes out-of-stage logic as defined in Stage Settlement
Set Current Environment Time: Instantly switch Environment Time to the specified hour. The parameter must be a Floating Point Number between 0 and 24 If the target hour is earlier than the current hour, it is treated as the next day (+1 day)
Must be a floating point value between 0–24; this Node will not take effect if the value is outside this range
Set Environment Time Passage Speed: Minutes elapsed per second, limited to 0 - 60 (Teyvat speed is 1)
Clamped to the range 0–60. Values outside this range are automatically set to 0 or 60
Set Entity Faction: Set the faction of the specified target entity.
Entity whose faction is to be edited
Teleport Player: Teleport the specified Player Entity. A loading interface may appear depending on teleport distance
Revive Character: The Character Entity to be revived
Revive All Player's Characters: Revive all character entities of a specified player, but this node is only effective when the player is in a state where all their characters are down. In Beyond Mode, since each player has only one character, this node has the same effect as the "Revive Character" node. In Classic Mode, players can have multiple characters. If only some of the characters are down, this node will not take effect, meaning it will not revive the downed characters.
The Player Entity that owns the Character
If set to False, the Revive Count will not be deducted
Defeat All Player's Characters: Knock down all characters of the specified player, causing the player to enter When All Player's Characters Are Down state .
The Player Entity that owns the Character
Activate Revive Point: Activate the specified Revive Point ID for the player. When the player later triggers Revive logic, they can revive at this Revive Point
Set Player Revive Time: Set the duration for the Player's next revive. If the Player is currently reviving, this does not affect the ongoing revive process
Set Player Remaining Revives: Set the remaining number of revives for the specified Player. When set to 0, the Player cannot revive
When set to 0, the player will not be revived
Set Environment Configuration: Apply the specified Environment Configuration to the designated player. Takes effect immediately upon execution
Applies only to Players in the specified list
The Weather Configuration matching this ID will take effect. If the ID does not exist, nothing happens
Allow/Forbid Player to Revive: Set whether the specified player is allowed to revive
If set to True, reviving is allowed
Deactivate Revive Point: Unregister the specified Revive Point ID for the player. The layer will not revive at this Revive Point next time
Set Character's Elemental Energy: Available only in Classic Mode, sets the elemental energy for a specific character.
Increases Character's Elemental Energy: Available only in Classic Mode, increases the elemental energy for a specific character.
Activate/Disable Extra Collision: Edit data in the Entity's Extra Collision Component to enable/disable Extra Collision
Activate/Disable Extra Collision Climbab: Edit the Climbability of the Entity's Extra Collision Component
Activate/Disable Native Collision Climba: Edit the Climbability of the Entity's Native Collision
Activate/Disable Collision Trigger: Edit the Collision Trigger Component data to Activate/Disable the Trigger at the specified ID
Initiate Attack: Make the specified Entity initiate an attack. The Entity that uses this node must have the corresponding Ability Unit configured. There are two usage modes: When the Ability Unit is [Hitbox Attack], it executes a hitbox attack centered on the Target Entity's Location When the Ability Unit is [Direct Attack], it directly attacks the Target Entity
Depending on the Ability Unit, this can be treated either as the reference target for the Hitbox Location or as the attack target
The coefficient applied to the damage dealt by this attack
The incremental damage applied by this attack
When using Hitbox Attack, determines the Hitbox offsetWhen using Direct Attack, determines the hit-detection location for the attack and thus where on-hit special effects are created
When using Hitbox Attack, determines the Hitbox rotationWhen using Direct Attack, determines the hit-detection location for the attack and thus the rotation used for on-hit effects
Referenced Ability Unit. Must be configured on the entity associated with this Node Graph

When set to True, the four parameters — Damage Coefficient, Damage Increment, Location Offset, and Rotation Offset — overwrite parameters of the same name in the Ability Unit. When set to False, the Ability Unit's original configuration is used
Determines the Initiator Entity for this attack. Defaults to the Entity associated with this Node Graph. Affects which attacker is identified in events such as On Hit and When Attacked
Recover HP: Restore HP to the specified Target Entity via an Ability Unit
The amount of HP restored in this healing instance
Referenced Ability Unit. Must be configured on the entity associated with this Node Graph
When set to True, the Recovery Amount overwrites the parameter of the same name in the Ability Unit. When set to False, the Ability Unit's original configuration is used

Determines the Initiator Entity of this healing action. Defaults to the Entity associated with this Node Graph. Affects healer identification in events such asWhen HP Is RecoveredandWhen Initiating HP Recovery
HP Loss: Directly cause the specified target to lose HP. Losing HP is not an attack, so it does not trigger attack-related events
The amount of HP lost in this instance
If set to False, this HP loss will leave the Target with at least 1 HP remaining
If set to True, and the Target is set to Invincible via Unit Status, HP loss has no effect
Can be Blocked by Locked HP?
If set to True, and the Target's HP is locked via Unit Status, HP loss has no effect
Recover HP Directly: Directly restore HP to the specified Target Entity. Unlike [Recover HP], this node does not require an Ability Unit
The Target Entity to be healed
The amount of HP restored in this healing instance
If set to True, this healing amount is not affected by the Target's Unit Status effects that adjust healing
The Aggro generated by this healing, expressed as a multiplier. Only applicable when using Custom Aggro Mode
The Aggro generated by this healing, expressed as an incremental value. Only applicable when using Custom Aggro Mode
The list of tags associated with this healing action. These can be accessed in theWhen HP Is RecoveredandWhen Initiating HP Recoveryevents to identify a specific healing action
Recover Basic Motion Device: Resume a paused Basic Motion Device on the Target Entity. The Target Entity must have the Basic Motion Device Component
Activate Fixed-Point Motion Device: Dynamically add a Fixed-Point Basic Motion Device to the Target Entity during Stage runtime
Options: Fixed Speed or Fixed Time
Activate Basic Motion Device: Activate a Basic Motion Device configured within the Target Entity's Basic Motion Device Component
Add Target-Oriented Rotation-Based Motio: Dynamically add a Basic Motion Device with Target-Oriented Rotation to the Target Entity during Stage runtime
The duration for which this motion device remains active
Add Uniform Basic Linear Motion Device: Dynamically add a Basic Motion Device with Uniform Linear Motion at runtime
The duration for which this motion device remains active
Determines the magnitude and direction of the velocity
Add Uniform Basic Rotation-Based Motion: Dynamically add a Basic Motion Device with Uniform Rotation at runtime
The duration for which this motion device remains active
Stop and Delete Basic Motion Device: Stop and delete a running Motion Device
If set to True, stops all Basic Motion Devices on this Entity. If set to False, stops only the Motion Device whose name matches the specified Motion Device
Pause Basic Motion Device: Pause a running Motion Device. The Resume Motion Device node can then be used to resume it
Activate/Disable Follow Motion Device: Enable/Disable the Follow Motion Device logic on the Target Entity
Switch Follow Motion Device Target by GU: Switch the Follow Target of the Follow Motion Device by GUID
Name of the Attachment Point to follow
Location Offset based on the Follow Coordinate System
Rotation Offset based on the Follow Coordinate System
Options: Relative Coordinate System or World Coordinate System
Options: Completely Follow, Follow Location, Follow Rotation
Switch Follow Motion Device Target by En: Switch the Follow Target of the Follow Motion Device by Entity
The Entity that follows the Target
Name of the Attachment Point to follow
Location Offset based on the Follow Coordinate System
Rotation Offset based on the Follow Coordinate System
Options: Relative Coordinate System or World Coordinate System
Options: Completely Follow, Follow Location, Follow Rotation
Create Projectile: Create a Projectile Entity using the Prefab ID. This function is similar to [Create Prefab], but includes an additional [Track Target] parameter, which sets the tracking target for projectiles of the Tracking type in the Projectile Motion Device Component of the created Entity
Determines whether the created entity belongs to another entity
The Tracking Target set by the Tracking Projectile type in the Projectile Motion Device component
When set to False, the [Level] parameter has no effect
Determines the Level when the entity is created
Determines the Unit Tags carried when this entity is created
This Entity inherits the attributes of the Projectile Prefab
Play Timed Effects: Play a Timed Effect relative to the Target Entity. A valid Target Entity and Attachment Point are required
If the Entity does not exist, the Effect will not play
If the Attachment Point Name does not exist, the Special Effect will not play
If set to True, follows the Target Entity's Motion
If set to True, follows the Target Entity's Rotation
Location Offset relative to the Target Entity's specified Attachment Point
Rotation offset relative to the Target Entity's specified Attachment Point
The Zoom Multiplier of this Effect
If set to True, plays the built-in Sound Effect as well
Clear Special Effects Based on Special E: Clear all Effects on the specified Target Entity that use the given Effect Asset. Applies to Looping Effects only
Mount Looping Special Effect: Mount a Looping Effect relative to the Target Entity. A valid Target Entity and Attachment Point are required This node returns an Effect Instance ID that can be stored. When using the [Clear Looping Effects] node later, use this Effect Instance ID to clear the specified Looping Effect
If the Entity does not exist, the Effect will not play
If the Attachment Point Name does not exist, the Special Effect will not play
If set to True, follows the Target Entity's Motion
If set to True, follows the Target Entity's Rotation
Location Offset relative to the Target Entity's specified Attachment Point
Rotation offset relative to the Target Entity's specified Attachment Point
The Zoom Multiplier of this Effect
The Instance ID automatically generated when mounting this Effect
Clear Looping Special Effect: Clear the specified Looping Effect on the Target Entity by Effect Instance ID. After a successful mount, the [Mount Looping Effect] node generates an Effect Instance ID
Instance ID automatically generated by the Mount Looping Special Effect node
Resume Timer: Resume a paused Timer on the Target Entity
Start Timer: Start a Timer on the Target Entity The Timer is uniquely identified by its name A Timer consists of a looping or non-looping Timer Sequence. The Timer Sequence is a set of time points in seconds arranged in ascending order; when the Timer reaches these points, it triggers the [On Timer Triggered] event. The maximum length of a Timer Sequence is 100 For example, if you input the Timer Sequence [1, 3, 5, 7], the [On Timer Triggered] event fires at 1s, 3s, 5s, and 7s When Loop is set to "Yes," the Timer restarts from 0s after reaching the last time point. For [1, 3, 5, 7], it restarts from 0s after reaching 7s
If set to True, the Timer Sequence executes in a loop
Provide a list sorted in ascending order. If the list is invalid (not strictly ascending, contains negatives, etc.), the Timer will not run
Pause Timer: Pauses the specified Timer on the Target Entity. The [Resume Timer] node can then be used to resume its countdown
Stop Timer: Completely terminate the specified Timer on the Target Entity; it cannot be resumed
Recover Global Timer: Resume a paused Global Timer on the Target Entity
Identifier for the Timer. Only Timer Names configured in Timer Management can be referenced
Start Global Timer: Start a Global Timer on the Target Entity The Timer on the Target Entity is uniquely identified by its name Based on Timer Management settings, Countdown and Stopwatch Timers are created accordingly
Identifier for the Timer. Only Timer Names configured in Timer Management can be referenced
Increase Global Timer Value: Adjust the time of a running Global Timer via the Node Graph If the timer is paused first and then modified to reduce the time, the modified time will be at least 0 seconds. For countdown timers, pausing followed by modifying the time to 0s will trigger the [When the Global Timer Is Triggered] event upon resuming the timer. If the timer is paused first, then modified to 0s, followed by modifying the time to increase it, and finally resumed, the [When the Global Timer Is Triggered] event will not be triggered.
Identifier for the Timer. Only Timer Names configured in Timer Management can be referenced

For a Countdown Timer, a positive value increases the remaining time; a negative value decreases the remaining timeIf the timer is set to Stopwatch, a positive value increases the accumulated time, while a negative value decreases it
Pause Global Timer: Pause a running Global Timer via the Node Graph When paused, the UI controls linked to the timer will also pause their display
Identifier for the Timer. Only Timer Names configured in Timer Management can be referenced
Stop Global Timer: Use the node graph to stop running a global timer early
Identifier for the Timer. Only Timer Names configured in Timer Management can be referenced
Switch Main Camera Template: Switch the Main Camera Template for the target Player List to the specified Template
Set Character Disruptor Device: Edit the Character Disruptor Device active on the Target Entity by ID; if the ID does not exist, the change has no effect
Identifier for the Character Disruptor Device
Add Unit Status: Add a specified Stack Count of Unit Status to the Target Entity
Determines the Applier Entity for this action. Defaults to the Entity associated with this Node Graph
The Entity that actually receives this Unit Status
The Stack Count for this Unit Status
You can carry a set of parameters to override the configuration values in the unit's state.

Failed, other exceptionsFailed: Yielded to another status. A yielding relationship exists between the Target's current Unit Status and the one being appliedFailed: Maximum coexistence limit reached. The specified Unit Status on the Target Entity has reached its Coexistence LimitFailed: Unable to add additional stack. Stack addition failedSuccess: New status applied. Successfully applied new Unit StatusSuccess: Slot stacking. Target already has this Unit Status, stacking applied
If application succeeds, returns the Unit Status Slot ID containing the instance
Remove Unit Status: Remove a specified Unit Status from the Target Entity. Either all stacks or a single stack can be removed
The Entity from which the Unit Status will be removed

All Coexisting Statuses with the Same Name: Removes all statuses applied with this Config ID that share the same nameStatus With Fastest Stack Loss: Removes one stack from the status that loses stacks the fastest
Determines the Remover Entity for this action. Defaults to the Entity associated with this Node Graph
Activate/Disable Tab: Edit the Tab state by ID in the Target Entity's Tab Component
If set to True, it is active and can be selected
Activate/Disable Collision Trigger Sourc: Edit the state of the Collision Trigger Source Component on the Target Entity
If set to True, activates collision with Entities that carry Collision Trigger Components
Change Player's Current Class Level: Set the Player's current Class Level. If it exceeds the defined range, the change will not take effect
Change Player Class: Set the Player's current Class to the Class referenced by the Config ID
Increase Player's Current Class EXP: Increase the Player's current Class EXP. Any excess beyond the maximum Level will not take effect
Amount of EXP to be increased
Activate UI Control Group in Control Gro: Activate the UI Control Groups stored as Custom Templates in the UI Control Group Library within the Target Player's Interface Layout
Identifier for the UI Control Group
Switch Current Interface Layout: Switch the Target Player's current Interface Layout via Layout ID
Set UI Control (Group) Status: Edit the state of the UI Control in the Target Player's Interface Layout by its UI Control ID
Off: Invisible and logic not runningOn: Visible and logic running normallyHidden: Invisible and logic running normally
Remove Interface Control Group From Cont: Remove the UI Control Groups activated via [ Activate UI Control Group in Control Group Library ] from the Target Player's Interface Layout
Identifier for the UI Control Group
Set Skill CD Based on Maximum CD Percent: Modify the skill in a character's skill slot by adjusting the percentage of the skill's maximum cooldown time.
The Skill Slot to edited: Normal Attack, Skill 1-E, Skill 2-Q, Skill 3-R, Skill 4-T, or Custom Skill
The revised actual cooldown time is: original cooldown time * ratio value
If set to True, the edited Cooldown cannot be less than the specified minimum value
Initialize Character Skill: Reset the Target Character's skills to those defined in the Class Template
The Skill Slot to initialize: Normal Attack, Skill 1-E, Skill 2-Q, Skill 3-R, Skill 4-T, or Custom Skill
Set Skill Resource Amount: Edit the Character's skill resource amount
Edited value will be set to this input value
Set Character Skill CD: Directly set the cooldown time of a specific skill slot on the target character to a specified value.
The Skill Slot to edited: Normal Attack, Skill 1-E, Skill 2-Q, Skill 3-R, Skill 4-T, or Custom Skill
Edited Cooldown will be set to this input value
If set to True, the edited Cooldown cannot be less than the specified minimum value
Add Character Skill: Add a skill to the specified Target Character's Skill Slot
The Skill Slot to be added: Normal Attack, Skill 1-E, Skill 2-Q, Skill 3-R, Skill 4-T, or Custom Skill
Increase Skill Resource Amount: Modifying the resource amount of a skill will add an increase to the current value; this increase can be a negative number.
The modified value is: original value + increase value.
Increase Character Skill CD: Modifying the cooldown of a target character's skill slot will add an increase to the current cooldown time; this increase can be a negative number.
The Skill Slot to edited: Normal Attack, Skill 1-E, Skill 2-Q, Skill 3-R, Skill 4-T, or Custom Skill
The modified value is: original value + increase value.
If set to True, the edited Cooldown cannot be less than the specified minimum value
Delete Character Skill by Slot: Delete the skill in the specified slot of the Target Character
The Skill Slot to be deleted: Normal Attack, Skill 1-E, Skill 2-Q, Skill 3-R, Skill 4-T, or Custom Skill
Delete Character Skill by ID: Iterate through and delete all skills with the specified Config ID across all of the Character's slots
Adjust Specified Sound Effect Player: Adjust the volume and playback speed of the Sound Effect Player with the specified ID in the Sound Effect Player Component on the Target Entity
Close Specified Sound Effect Player: Disable the Sound Effect Player with the specified ID in the Sound Effect Player Component on the specified Target Entity
Start/Pause Player Background Music: Edit the background music state for the specified Player
Start/Pause Specified Sound Effect Playe: Edit the state of the Sound Effect Player with the specified ID in the Sound Effect Player Component on the Target Entity. This node is only active when the sound effect is set to loop playback. It does not take effect for sound effects configured for single-playback.
Add Sound Effect Player: Dynamically add a Sound Effect Player. The Unit must have a Sound Effect Player Component
Player Plays One-Shot 2D Sound Effect: Player plays a one-shot 2D Sound Effect
Clear Unit Tags from Entity: Clear Unit Tags for the specified Entity
Add Unit Tag to Entity: Add Unit Tags to the specified Entity
Remove Unit Tag from Entity: Remove Unit Tags from the specified Entity
Taunt Target: Available only in Custom Aggro Mode Make the Taunter Entity taunt the specified Target Entity
Remove Target Entity From Aggro List: Available only in Custom Aggro Mode Remove the Target Entity from the Aggro Owner's Aggro List; this may cause the target to leave battle
Clear Specified Target's Aggro List: Available only in Custom Aggro Mode Clear the Aggro Owner's Aggro List. This may cause them to leave battle
Set the Aggro Value of Specified Entity: Available only in Custom Aggro Mode Set the Aggro Value of the specified Target Entity on the specified Aggro Owner
Send Signal: Send a custom Signal to the global Stage. Before use, select the corresponding Signal name to ensure correct parameter usage
Set Entity Active Nameplate: Set the active Nameplate list for the specified target. Nameplates included in the input list are enabled, while those not included are disabled
Switch Active Text Bubble: In the Target Entity's Text Bubble Component, replace the current active Text Bubble with the one corresponding to the Config ID
Close Deck Selector: Close the currently active Deck Selector for the specified Player
Invoke Deck Selector: Open the pre-made Deck Selector for the Target Player
Specify the runtime Player to invoke the Deck Selector
If empty, uses the Deck Selector's default configuration; otherwise, this time value is used as the effective durationUnit in seconds
One-to-one with display items: the Deck Selector returns the result value corresponding to each display itemRecommended configuration: 1 to X
The minimum number of cards that must be selected for a valid interaction
The maximum number of cards that can be selected for a valid interaction
The minimum and maximum refresh count parameters are invalid, and the selection interface has no Refresh button
Both input parameters (minimum and maximum refresh count) take effect, and the selection screen includes a refresh button
Both input parameters (minimum and maximum refresh count) are ignored. All results are returned by default, and the selection screen includes a refresh button
The minimum number of cards that must be selected for a valid refresh interaction.
The maximum number of cards that can be selected for a valid refresh interaction
If the Deck Selector times out, has no interaction, or closes abnormally, force-assign this configured resultThe length of this Result List must match the valid card selection count
Set Player Settlement Scoreboard Data Di: Set the Player's Scoreboard display data, which is shown on the Scoreboard after Stage Settlement. Since this node involves the display of external functions, [Data Value] and [Data Name] currently support multilingual translation only when manually entering text. If entered via connection input, multilingual translation is not supported.
The sort order of this data
The value of this data. Supports Integer, Floating Point Number, and String
Set Player Settlement Ranking Value: Set the Player's ranking value after Settlement, then determine the final ranking order according to [Ranking Value Comparison Order] in [Stage Settings] – [Settlement]
Set Faction Settlement Ranking Value: Set the faction's ranking value after Settlement, then determine the final ranking order according to [Ranking Value Comparison Order] in [Stage Settings] – [Settlement]
Toggle Entity Light Source: Adjust the Light Source state at the specified ID in the Light Source Component on the Target Entity
If set to True, turns On
Sort Dictionary by Key: Sort and output the specified Dictionary by keys in ascending or descending order
Sort Dictionary by Value: Sort and output the specified Dictionary by values in ascending or descending order
Set or Add Key Value Pairs to Dictionary: Add a Key-Value Pair to the specified Dictionary
Clear Dictionary: Clear all Key-Value Pairs from the specified Dictionary
Remove Key Value Pairs from Dictionary b: Remove Key-Value Pairs from the specified Dictionary by key
Modify Structure: After selecting a Structure, you can edit each parameter of that Structure
Remove Item From Inventory Shop Sales Li: Remove items from the inventory shop's sales list
The Shop ID corresponding to the Shop component on the Shop Owner Entity
Remove Item From Purchase List: Remove items from the purchase list
The Shop ID corresponding to the Shop component on the Shop Owner Entity
Remove Item From CustomShop Sales List: Remove items from the custom shop's sales list
The Shop ID corresponding to the Shop component on the Shop Owner Entity
Open Shop: Open the Shop from the Player Entity's perspective during gameplay
The Shop ID corresponding to the Shop component on the Shop Owner Entity
Close Shop: Close all open Shops from the Player Entity's perspective during gameplay
Add New Item to Inventory Shop Sales Lis: Add new items to the inventory shop's sales list
The Shop ID corresponding to the Shop component on the Shop Owner Entity
Add Items to the Purchase List: Add New Items to the Item Purchase List
The Shop ID corresponding to the Shop component on the Shop Owner Entity
Add New Item to Custom Shop Sales List: Add items to the Custom Shop Sales List. Upon success, an Integer ID is generated in the Output Parameter as the item identifier
The Shop ID corresponding to the Shop component on the Shop Owner Entity
Set Inventory Shop Item Sales Info: Set up information on items for sale in the inventory shop.
The Shop ID corresponding to the Shop component on the Shop Owner Entity
Set Item Purchase Info in the Purchase L: The Shop ID corresponding to the Shop component on the Shop Owner Entity
Set Custom Shop Item Sales Info: Set custom store product sales information
The Shop ID corresponding to the Shop component on the Shop Owner Entity
Set Equipment Affix Value: Sets the value on the corresponding entry for a specified equipment instance.
Integer ID generated during Equipment Initialization to identify the equipment instance
Remove Equipment Affix: Remove the specified Affix from the Equipment instance
Integer ID generated during Equipment Initialization to identify the equipment instance
Add Affix to Equipment: Add a preconfigured Affix to the specified Equipment instance, with the option to overwrite the Affix value
Integer ID generated during Equipment Initialization to identify the equipment instance
The Config ID of the preconfigured Affix defined in Equipment Data Management
Can overwrite the value on a pre-configured Affix
Add Affix to Equipment at Specified ID: Add a preconfigured Affix at the specified Affix ID on the Equipment instance, with the option to overwrite the Affix value
Integer ID generated during Equipment Initialization to identify the equipment instance
The Config ID of the preconfigured Affix defined in Equipment Data Management
Can overwrite the value on a pre-configured Affix
Replace Equipment to the Specified Slot: Replaces the specified equipment in the corresponding equipment slot of the target entity. If the equipment is already equipped in the equipment slot, the replacement will not take effect. If the target slot already contains an equipped item, that item will be replaced.
The equipment instance is identified by an integer index generated during equipment initialization.
Set InventoryItem Drop Contents: Configure the Inventory Item drop data in Dictionary format, and specify the Drop Type
Types: Shared Reward (one share for all), Individualized Reward (one share per person)
Set Inventory Drop Items/Currency Amount: Set the type and quantity of Items or Currency for the Inventory drop
Types: Shared Reward (one share for all), Individualized Reward (one share per person)
Trigger Loot Drop: Triggers a loot drop for the dropper entity, with configurable loot type.
Types: Shared Reward (one share for all), Individualized Reward (one share per person)
Set Loot Drop Content: Configure the Loot drop data in the Loot Component on the Dropper Entity in Dictionary format
Increase Inventory Item Quantity: Modifying the quantity of a specified item in your inventory will add an increase to the current value; the increase can be a negative number.
The changed value = original value + increase value
Increase Inventory Currency Quantity: Modify the amount of a specified currency in the player's inventory. This will add the specified increase value to the current amount, and the increase value can be negative.
The changed value = original value + increase value
Increase Loot Component Item Quantity: Modify the quantity of a specified item in the drop component of a loot prefab. This will add the specified increase value to the current quantity, and the increase value can be negative.
The changed value = original value + increase value
Increase Loot Component Currency Quantit: Modify the amount of a specified currency in the drop component of a loot prefab. This will add the specified increase value to the current amount, and the increase value can be negative.
The changed value = original value + increase value
Increase Maximum Inventory Capacity: Increase the maximum Inventory capacity of the specified Inventory Owner
Set Player List for Visible Mini-Map Mar: The mini-map marker at the specified ID in the Target Entity's Mini-map Marker Component is visible to all Players in the Player List
Entity that owns the Mini-map Marker component to be edited
ID of the specified Mini-map Marker to be edited
The specified Mini-map ID on the Target Entity, visible only to the Player providing input
Set Player Markers on the Mini-Map: When the Player Marker option is selected and a corresponding Player Entity is linked in the Node Graph, the Target Entity's display on the mini-map changes to that Player's avatar
Entity that owns the Mini-map Marker component to be edited
ID of the specified Mini-map Marker to be edited
Changes the avatar of the corresponding Player Entity
Set Mini-Map Marker Activation Status: Edit the active state of mini-map markers on the Target Entity in batches using the input list of Mini-map Marker IDs
Entity that owns the Mini-map Marker component to be edited
List of Mini-map Marker IDs to be set to the specified statusUnconfigured Mini-map Markers will be set to the opposite status

If input is True,the Mini-map Markers corresponding to the specified ID numbers in the input list will be set to EnabledFor IDs not in the input list, the corresponding Mini-map Markers will be set to Disabled
Set Mini-Map Zoom: Set the map scale of the mini-map interface control for the target player.
Set Player List for Tracking Mini-Map Ma: Set the mini-map marker of the target entity with the corresponding index to a tracking appearance for the specified player.
Switch Creation Patrol Template: Immediately switch the patrol template for the Creation and move according to the new template
Set Player Leaderboard Score as a Float: The ID corresponding to the specified Leaderboard in Peripheral System management
Set Player Leaderboard Score as an Integ: The ID corresponding to the specified Leaderboard in Peripheral System management
Change Achievement Progress Tally: Change the progress counter for the specified Achievement ID on the Target Entity
New Value = Previous Value + Change Value
Set Achievement Progress Tally: Set the progress counter for the specified Achievement ID on the Target Entity
Sets the Progress Count to the input value
Set Scan Tag Rules: Configure rules for Scan Tags. The scanning logic is executed based on the configured rules
Set Scan Component's Active Scan Tag ID: Set the Scan Tag with the specified ID in the Target Entity's Scan Tag Component to the active state
Switch the Scoring Group that Affects Pl: Switch the active Scoring Group of the specified Player's Ranking by Scoring Group ID
The ID corresponding to the specified Score Group in Peripheral System management
Set Player Rank Score Change: Set the Player's rank score change based on the settlement status
Set Player Escape Validity: Set whether escaping is permitted for the specified Player
Activate/Disable Entity Deployment Group: Edit the Initial Creation Switch state of the Entity Layout Group
If set to True, the Entity Layout Group's Initial Creation switch is enabled
Set Player's Current Channel: Set the Player's currently available channels. Channels in the list are available to the Player, and channels not in the list are unavailable
Set Player Channel Permissions: If set to True, the channel is available to the specified Player
Consume Gift Box: Consume the specified Player's Wonderland Gift Box
Enable/Disable Pathfinding Obstacle: You can modify whether the pathfinding obstacke component of the target entity, corresponding to the specified index, is active.
Enable/Disable Pathfinding Obstacle Feat: You can modify whether the pathfinding obstacle function of the target entity is activated.
Set the Preset Status Value of the Compl: You can set the preset state value for a specified preset state index of a complex creation.
When Node Graph Variable Changes: This event is triggered when a Node Graph Variable in the current Node Graph changes The previous and current values are Generic. Determine the Generic type to correctly receive events for Node Graph Variables of the corresponding type Vessel-type Node Graph Variables do not provide before-value and after-value Output Parameters
The Entity associated with this Node Graph
GUID of the Entity associated with this Node Graph
Name of the Variable that was changed
The Variable's value before the change
The Variable's value after the change
When Custom Variable Changes: This event is triggered when the Custom Variable of the Entity associated with the current Node Graph changes The previous and current values are Generic. Determine the Generic type before you can correctly receive events for Custom Variables of the corresponding type Vessel-type Custom Variables do not provide before-value and after-value Output Parameters
The Entity associated with this Node Graph
GUID of the Entity associated with this Node Graph
Name of the Variable that was changed
The Variable's value before the change
The Variable's value after the change
When Preset Status Changes: This event is triggered when the Preset Status of the Entity associated with the Node Graph changes
When Character Movement SPD Meets Condit: Adds the Unit Status effect [ Monitor Movement Speed ] to the Character Entity. This event is triggered when the conditions are met
When Entity Is Created: This event is triggered when an Entity is created All types of Entities can trigger this event. Stage Entities, Character Entities, and Player Entities trigger this event when entering a Stage
When Entity Is Destroyed: This event triggers when objects and creations within the stage are destroyed. This event can only trigger on stage entities.
On destroy, captures a snapshot of the Custom Variable component on this Entity. Use the Search Custom Variable Snapshot node to retrieve its Custom Variable values
When Entity Is Removed/Destroyed: This event is triggered when any Entity in the Stage is removed or destroyed, and it can only be triggered on Stage Entities This event is triggered upon Entity destruction or removal. Therefore, when an Entity is destroyed, it triggers both the [On Entity Destroyed] and [On Entity Removed/Destroyed] events in sequence
When Entity Faction Changes: This event is triggered when an Entity's Faction changes
When the Character Is Down: When a Character is Downed, the Node Graph on the Character Entity can trigger this event

Node Graph caused: the Character was Downed by the Destroy Entity node in the Node GraphNormal Down: the Character was Downed because HP reached 0Abnormal Down: the character was downed due to drowning, falling into an abyss, etc.
When Character Revives: When a Character is Revived, the Node Graph on the Character Entity can trigger this event
When Player Teleport Completes: This event is triggered on the Player Entity's Node Graph when the Player completes teleportation This event is also triggered when a Player enters a Stage for the first time
When All Player's Characters Are Down: This event is triggered on the Player Entity's Node Graph when all of the Player's Character Entities are Downed

Node Graph caused: the Character was Downed by the Destroy Entity node in the Node GraphNormal Down: the Character was Downed because HP reached 0Abnormal Down: the character was downed due to drowning, falling into an abyss, etc.
When All Player's Characters Are Revived: This event is triggered on the Player Entity's Node Graph when all of the Player's Characters are Revived
When Player Is Abnormally Downed and Rev: This event is triggered on the Player Entity when a Character is Downed and then Revived due to drowning, falling into an abyss, or similar reasons
When the Active Character Changes: Available only in Classic Mode. This event is triggered on the player entity when the active character changes.
When Entering Collision Trigger: The "Collision Trigger Source" range of a runtime entity A enters the "Collision Trigger" range of another runtime entity B Node graph events will be sent to the entity B configured with "Collision Trigger"
The trigger with the corresponding ID in Entity B's Collision Trigger Component
When Exiting Collision Trigger: When the "Collision Trigger Source" range of active Entity A leaves the "Collision Trigger" range of active Entity B Node graph events will be sent to the entity B configured with "Collision Trigger"
When HP Is Recovered: This event is triggered when an Entity's HP is restored
Actual healing amount. If the Entity had not lost any HP prior to healing, the amount is 0
When Initiating HP Recovery: This event is triggered on the initiating Entity when an Entity restores HP to other Entities
Actual healing amount. If the Target Entity had not lost any HP prior to healing, the amount is 0
When Attack Hits: This event is triggered when an Entity's attack hits other Entities (In Classic Mode, due to the Craftsperson's settings, the actual damage may differ from other scenarios.)
Actual damage dealt. If no damage is dealt due to Invincible or other reasons, the amount is 0
When Attacked: This event is triggered when the Entity is attacked (In Classic Mode, due to the Craftsperson's settings, the actual damage may differ from other scenarios.)
Actual damage dealt. If no damage is dealt due to Invincible or other reasons, the amount is 0
When Entering an Interruptible State: Available only in Beyond Mode. This event is triggered when an Entity is attacked and enters the Vulnerable Status
When Basic Motion Device Stops: This event is sent to the Component Owner when a Basic Motion Device on the Basic Motion Device Component completes its movement or is disabled
When Path Reaches Waypoint: When the Pathing Motion Device reaches a Waypoint, it sends this event to the Owner of the Basic Motion Device Component. This event is triggered only if "Send Event on Waypoint Arrival" is enabled in the Waypoint settings
When On-Hit Detection Is Triggered: This event is triggered when the On-Hit Detection Component's Owner hits other Entities or the Scene
If set to False: The environment was hitIf set to True: An Entity was hit. Retrieve values from the Hit Entity output parameter
Hit Entity is only valid when a Hurtbox is hit
When Timer Is Triggered: This event is triggered when the Timer reaches the specified time node
When Global Timer Is Triggered: This event is triggered when the Global Countdown Timer reaches zero The Global Stopwatch Timer does not trigger this event
When UI Control Group Is Triggered: Only UI Controls of the Interactive Button and Item Display types trigger this event The Node Graph event "UI Control Group Triggered" is sent during Stage runtime when a UI Control Group created through an Interactive Button or an Item Display UI Control is interacted with. This event can only be received by the Node Graph of the Player who triggered the interaction
If the UI control that triggered this event forms a multi-control UI group with other controls, this output parameter returns the corresponding group value

If the triggering UI control is a single-control UI group, this value represents the ID of that UI control groupIf the triggering UI control is part of a multi-control UI group, this value represents the ID of the control within that group
When Unit Status Changes: This event is triggered when the Stack Count of a Unit Status changes This event is triggered when Unit Status effects are applied or removed
ID of the Unit Status slot that changed
When Unit Status Ends: This event is triggered when a Unit Status is removed for any reason or when its Runtime Duration expires

Status Replacement: The Unit Status was removed because it was replaced by another statusDuration Exceeded: The Unit Status exceeded its runtime durationDispelled: The Unit Status was removed directlyStatus Expired: The Unit Status became invalid due to other reasonsClass Changed: The Unit Status was removed due to a class change
ID of the Unit Status slot that changed
When Elemental Reaction Event Occurs: Adds the Unit Status effect [ Monitor Elemental Reaction ] to the Entity. This event is triggered when the conditions are met
When Shield Is Attacked: Adds the Unit Status effect [Add Shield] to the Entity. This event is triggered when the Shield takes damage
Shield Value of this Unit Status Before Attack
Shield Value of this Unit Status After Attack
When Tab Is Selected: When the active tab is selected, it will send an event to the node graph The Entity Node Graph configured by the Tab Component will receive this event
Entity with the tab component mounted
GUID of the Entity with the tab component mounted; outputs 0 if none exists
Character Entity that triggers the tab
When Creation Enters Combat: Only effective in Classic Aggro Mode This event is triggered when a Creation enters battle
When Creation Leaves Combat: Only effective in Classic Aggro Mode This event is triggered when a Creation leaves battle
When Player Class Level Changes: This event is triggered when a Player's Class Level changes and is sent to the corresponding Player. It can be received in that Class's Node Graph
When Player Class Changes: This event is triggered when a Player's Class changes and is sent to the corresponding Player. It can be received in the Node Graph of the new Class
When Player Class Is Removed: This event is triggered when a Player's Class is removed and sent to the corresponding Player. It can be received in the Node Graph of the previous Class
When Skill Node Is Called: This event is triggered by the [Notify Server Node Graph] Node in the Skill Node Graph. Up to three strings can be passed in
When Aggro Target Changes: Available only in Custom Aggro Mode This event is triggered when the Aggro Target changes This event can also be triggered when entering or leaving battle
When Self Enters Combat: Available only in Custom Aggro Mode This event is triggered when the Entity itself enters battle
When Self Leaves Combat: Available only in Custom Aggro Mode This event is triggered when the Entity itself leaves battle
Monitor Signal: Monitors Signal trigger events defined in the Signal Manager The Signal name to monitor must be selected first
The Entity that sent this signal using the Send Signal node
When Deck Selector Is Complete: This event is triggered on the Player's Node Graph when the Player completes the Deck Selector, or when it is forcibly closed due to time constraints The output parameters report the Deck Selector's result and the corresponding reason

When a selection interaction is triggered, validselection resultsare returned as this output parameter, and the completion reason isCompleted by PlayerWhen aFull Refreshpop-up selection is triggered, the completeselection result listis returned as this output parameter, and the completion reason isRefresh AllWhen aFixed-Quantity Refreshpop-up selection is triggered, validselection resultsare returned as this output parameter, and the completion reason isFixed-Quantity RefreshWhen the Deck Selector times out with no interaction,the default selection is returnedis returned as this output parameter, and the completion reason isTimeoutWhenAllow Discard Selection is enabledand the Deck Selector is closed by the player,the default selection is returnedas this output parameter, and the completion reason isClosedManuallyWhen the Deck Selector is closed via the Node Graph,the default selection is returnedas this output parameter, and the completion reason isClosed byNode Graph
Six reason enumerationsCompleted by Player,Refresh All,Fixed-Quantity Refresh,Timeout, Closed Manually, Closed by Node Graph
When Text Bubble Is Completed: This event can only be mounted by Text Bubble Components and is received by the Entity's Node Graph that completed the dialogue Completion refers to when the final line of dialogue has finished playing
Runtime Entity with the Text Bubble component mounted
Target Character of the current Bubble dialogue
Currently active Text Bubble Config ID
Number of times the currently active Text Bubble has been fully played for this dialogue Character
When Selling Inventory Items in the Shop: This event is triggered when Inventory items are sold in the Shop. The Owner of the Shop Component will receive it
When Custom Shop Item Is Sold: This event is triggered when Custom items are sold in the Shop. The Owner of the Shop Component will receive it
When selling items to the shop: This event is triggered when items are purchased by the Shop. The Owner of the Shop Component will receive it
When Equipment Is Equipped: This event is triggered when Equipment is equipped. The Owner of the Equipment will receive it. Configure this in the Item Node Graph
When Equipment Is Unequipped: This event is triggered when Equipment is unequipped. The Owner of the Equipment will receive it. Configure this in the Item Node Graph
When Equipment Is Initialized: When Equipment is first obtained and enters the Inventory, it is initialized. The event's output parameters return the unique ID of the Equipment instance. Use this ID to edit the Equipment dynamically. The Owner of the Equipment will receive this event. Configure this in the Item Node Graph
When Equipment Affix Value Changes: This event is triggered when Equipment Affix values change. The Owner of the Equipment will receive it. Configure this in the Item Node Graph
The corresponding ID of this Entry within the Equipment Affixes
When Item Is Lost From Inventory: This event is triggered when an Item is removed from the Inventory (its quantity becomes 0). The Owner of the Inventory Component will receive it
When the Quantity of Inventory Item Chan: This event is triggered when the quantity of Items in the Inventory changes. The Owner of the Inventory Component will receive it
When Item Is Added to Inventory: This event is triggered when a new Item is added to the Inventory. The Owner of the Inventory Component will receive it. This event is not triggered by quantity-only changes
When the Quantity of Inventory Currency: This event is triggered when the amount of Inventory Currency changes. The Owner of the Inventory Component will receive it
When Items in the Inventory Are Used: This event is triggered when an Item in the Inventory is used. The Owner of the Inventory Component will receive it
When Creation Reaches Patrol Waypoint: When the Send Node Graph Event on Arrival option is enabled for a waypoint in the Patrol template, a Node Graph Event is triggered once the specified conditions are met This Node Graph Event can only be received by the creation's node graph
The GUID of the Creation. If it was not an initially placed Creation, the output is empty
The Patrol Template ID currently active on this Creation
The Path ID referenced by the Creation's currently active Patrol Template
The Waypoint ID the Creation has currently reached
The Waypoint ID the Creation will move to next
When Complex Creation Preset Status Chan: This event is triggered when the preset state of a complex creation is changed using the " Set the preset status value of the complex creation " node (the modified and unmodified values ​​must be different for this event to trigger). This node graph event can only be received by the node graph of the complex creation.
Multiple Branches: Accepts one input parameter as the control expression (supports Integer or String). Branches into multiple paths based on its value When the value on an Output Pin equals the control expression, execution continues along that Output Pin. If no pin matches, the [Default] pin is taken
Double Branch: Branches into True or False based on the evaluated condition When the Boolean is True, the [True] execution flow runs; when it is False, the [False] execution flow runs
Query Game Mode and Player Number: Searches the theoretical number of players entering the match, including players via Matchmaking or Room creation, and the method of entry
Includes Playtest, Room Play, and Matchmaking Play
Get Local Variable: Retrieves a Local Variable and optionally sets its [Initial Value] After setting the [Initial Value], the [Value] output parameter will be equal to the input [Initial Value] When the output [Local Variable] is connected to the [Set Local Variable] Execution Node's input [Local Variable], the input [Value] of [Set Local Variable] overwrites this Search Node's output [Value]. The next time you use [Get Local Variable], the output [Value] is the overwritten value
Allows you to set the default initial value for local variables
When not Overwritten, this value equals the Initial Value; after it is Overwritten, it equals the new value
Get Random Floating Point Number: Returns a random Floating Point Number that is ≥ the lower limit and ≤ the upper limit. The range is inclusive
Get Random Integer: Returns a random Integer that is ≥ the lower limit and ≤ the upper limit. The range is inclusive
Weighted Random: Takes a list of weights and randomly selects an ID based on the weight distribution For example, with a weight list {10, 20, 66, 4}, this node outputs 0, 1, 2, or 3 with probabilities 10%, 20%, 66%, and 4% respectively
Pi (\u03c0): Returns the approximate value of π (≈ 3.142)
Search List and Return Value ID: Find the specified value in the list and return a list of IDs where it appears For example, if the target list is {1,2,3,2,1} and the value is 1, the returned ID list is {0,4}, meaning 1 appears at IDs 0 and 4 in the target list
Returns an empty list if not found
Get Corresponding Value From List: Returns the value at the specified ID in the list (0-based)
Get List Length: Returns the length of the list (number of elements)
Get Maximum Value from List: Applies only to Floating Point Number or Integer lists; returns the maximum value
Get Minimum Value From List: Applies only to Floating Point Number or Integer lists; returns the minimum value
List Includes This Value: Returns whether the list contains the specified value
Query Custom Variable Snapshot: Searches the value of the specified Variable Name from the Custom Variable Component snapshot Only available for the [On Entity Destroyed] event
Get Node Graph Variable: Returns the value of the specified Node Graph Variable from the current Node Graph If the variable does not exist, returns the type's default value
Get Custom Variable: Returns the value of the specified Custom Variable from the Target Entity If the variable does not exist, returns the type's default value
Get Preset Status: Returns the value of the specified Preset Status for the Target Entity. Returns 0 if the Entity does not have that Preset Status
Query Character's Current Movement SPD: Can only be searched when the Character has the [Monitor Movement Speed] Unit Status effect
Query If Entity Is on the Field: Searches whether the specified Entity is present Note that Character Entities are still considered present even when Downed
Get All Entities on the Field: Returns all Entities currently present in the scene. The number of Entities in this List may be large
Get Specified Type of Entities on the Fi: Returns all Entities of the specified type currently in the scene. The number of Entities in this list may be large
Includes Stage, Object, Player, Character, Creation
Get Entities With Specified Prefab on th: Returns all Entities currently in the scene that were created by the specified Prefab ID
Get Character Attribute: Returns the Base Attributes of the Character Entity
Get Entity Advanced Attribute: Returns the Advanced Attributes of the Entity
Get Entity Type: Returns the Entity Type of the Target Entity
Includes Player, Character, Stage, Object, Creation.
Get Entity Location and Rotation: Returns the Location and Rotation of the Target Entity Not applicable to Player Entities or Stage Entities
Get Entity Forward Vector: Returns the Forward Vector of the specified Entity (the positive Z-axis direction in the Entity's relative coordinate system)
Get Entity Upward Vector: Returns the Upward Vector of the specified Entity (the positive Y-axis direction in the Entity's relative coordinate system)
Get Entity Right Vector: Returns the Right Vector of the specified Entity (the positive X-axis direction in the Entity's relative coordinate system)
Get List of Entities Owned by the Entity: Returns a list of all Entities owned by the Target Entity
Get Entity Elemental Attribute: Returns the Element Attributes of the Target Entity
Get Object Attribute: Returns the Base Attributes of the Object
Get Owner Entity: Returns the Owner Entity of the specified Target Entity
Get Entity List by Specified Range: Returns a list of Entities within a specified spherical range from the Target Entity List
Get Entity List by Specified Type: Returns a list of specified Entity types from the Target Entity List
Includes Player, Character, Stage, Object, Creation.
Get Entity List by Specified Prefab ID: Returns a list of Entities created with the specified Prefab ID from the Target Entity List
Get Entity List by Specified Faction: Returns the list of Entities belonging to a specific Faction from the Target Entity List
Get Self Entity: Returns the Entity associated with this Node Graph
Query GUID by Entity: Searches for the GUID of the specified Entity
Query Entity by GUID: Searches for an Entity by GUID
Check Entity's Elemental Effect Status: Lunar-Charged is not considered as Electro-Charged
Query Current Environment Time: Searches the current Environment Time, in the range [0, 24)
Query Game Time Elapsed: Searches how long the game has been running, in seconds
Query Entity Faction: Searches the Faction of the specified Entity
Query If Faction Is Hostile: Searches whether two Factions are hostile to each other
Query If All Player Characters Are Down: Check if all of the player's characters are downed
Get Player GUID by Player ID: Returns the Player GUID based on Player ID, where the ID indicates which Player they are
Get Player ID by Player GUID: Returns the Player ID based on Player GUID, where the ID indicates which Player they are
Get Player Client Input Device Type: Returns the Player's local input device type, as determined by the Interface mapping method
Get Player Entity to Which the Character: Returns the Player Entity that owns the Character Entity
Get Player Revive Time: Returns the revive duration of the specified Player Entity, in seconds
Get Player Remaining Revives: Returns the remaining number of revives for the specified Player Entity
Get List of Player Entities on the Field: Returns a list of all Player Entities present in the scene
Get All Character Entities of Specified: Returns a list of all Character Entities for the specified Player Entity
Get Active Character of Specified Player: Available only in Classic Mode, get the active character in the player's party.
Check Classic Mode Character ID: Available only in Classic Mode. You can search for the character ID of the target character to see the appendix for the specific character in [[mh4imrrhzdzi]] Classic Mode Character ID List
Get Follow Motion Device Target: Returns the Target of the Follow Motion Device, including the Target Entity and its GUID
Get Current Global Timer Time: Returns the current time of the specified Global Timer on the Target Entity
Get Player's Current UI Layout: Returns the ID of the currently active Interface Layout on the specified Player Entity
Get Creation's Current Target: The Target Entity varies with the Creation's current behavior For example, when a Creation is attacking, its Target is the specified enemy Entity For example, when a Creation is healing allies, its Target is the specified allied Entity
Current intelligently selected Target Entity of the Creation
Get Aggro List of Creation in Default Mo: Returns the Aggro List in Classic Mode. This Node only outputs a valid list when the Aggro Configuration is set to [Default Type]
Unordered list of Entities this Creation currently has Aggro against
Get Creation Attribute: Returns the Attributes of the specified Creation
Query Player Class Level: Searches the Player's Level of the specified Class
Query Player Class: Searches the Player's current Class; outputs the Config ID of that Class
Query Character Skill: Searches the Skill in the specified slot of a Character; outputs that Skill's Config ID
List of Slot IDs Querying Unit Status: Searches the list of all Slot IDs for the Unit Status with the specified Config ID on the Target Entity
Query If Entity Has Unit Status: Searches whether the specified Entity has a Unit Status with the given Config ID
Query Unit Status Stacks by Slot ID: Searches the Stack Count of the specified Unit Status on the Target Entity's designated Slot
Query Unit Status Applier by Slot ID: Searches the Applier of the specified Unit Status on the Target Entity's designated Slot
Get Entity List by Unit Tag: Returns a list of all Entities in the scene that carry this Unit Tag
Get Entity Unit Tag List: Returns a list of all Unit Tags carried by the Target Entity
Query Global Aggro Transfer Multiplier: Searches the Global Aggro Transfer Multiplier; it can be configured in [Stage Settings]
Query the Aggro Multiplier of the Specif: Query Aggro Multiplier of Specific Entity
Query the Aggro Value of the Specified E: Searches the Aggro Value of the Target Entity on its Aggro Owners
Query if Specified Entity Is in Combat: Searches whether the specified Entity has entered battle
Get List of Owners Who Have the Target i: Searches which Entities' Aggro Lists include the specified Target Entity
Get List of Owners That Have the Target: Searches which Entities have the Target Entity as their Aggro Target
Get the Aggro Target of the Specified En: Get Aggro Target of Specific Entity
Get the Number of Waypoints in the Globa: Get the number of Waypoints in the Global Path
Get Specified Waypoint Info: Searches the specified Waypoint information for the given Path
Get Preset Point List by Unit Tag: Searches all Preset Points that carry the Unit Tag by its ID; outputs each Preset Point's ID
Query Preset Point Position Rotation: Searches the Location and Rotation of the specified Preset Point
Get Player Settlement Ranking Value: Returns the Settlement ranking value for the specified Player Entity
Get Faction SettlementRanking Value: Returns the Settlement ranking value for the specified Faction
Query If Dictionary Contains Specific Ke: Searches whether the specified Dictionary contains the specified Key
Query If Dictionary Contains Specific Va: Searches whether the specified Dictionary contains the specified Value
Query Dictionary's Length: Searches the number of Key-Value Pairs in the Dictionary
Query Dictionary Value by Key: Searches the corresponding Value in the Dictionary by Key. If the Key does not exist, returns the type's default value
Get List of Keys from Dictionary: Returns a list of all Keys in the Dictionary. Because Key-Value Pairs are unordered, the Keys may not be returned in insertion order
Get List of Values from Dictionary: Returns a list of all Values in the Dictionary. Because Key-Value Pairs are unordered, the Values may not be returned in insertion order
Query Inventory Shop Item Sales Info: Searches sale information for a specified Item in the Inventory Shop
Query Inventory Shop Item Sales List: Search the inventory shop's sales list
Query Shop Item Purchase Info: Searches purchase information for a specified Item in the Shop
Query Custom Shop Item Sales List: Searches the Custom Shop sale list; the output parameter is a list of Item IDs
Query Custom Shop Item Sales Info: Searches sale information for a specified Item in the Custom Shop
Query Equipment Tag List: Searches the list of all Tags on this Equipment instance
Query Equipment Config ID by Equipment I: Searches the Equipment Config ID by Equipment ID. The Equipment Instance ID can be obtained in the [Equipment Initialization] event
Get Equipment Affix List: Returns a list of all Affixes on this Equipment instance When Equipment is initialized, Affix values are randomized, so the Equipment Affixes on the Equipment instance also generate corresponding instances. Therefore, the data type is Integer rather than Config ID
Get Equipment Affix Config ID: Returns the Config ID of an Equipment Affix by its ID on the Equipment instance
Get Equipment Affix Value: Returns the value of the Affix at the specified ID on the Equipment instance
Get the Equipment Index of the Specified: Get the equipment index of the specified equipment slot
Get Inventory Item Quantity: Returns the quantity of the Item with the specified Config ID in the Inventory
Get Inventory Currency Quantity: Returns the amount of Currency with the specified Config ID in the Inventory
Get All Currency From Inventory: Returns all Currencies in the Inventory, including types and corresponding amounts
Get all basic items from Inventory: Returns all Basic Items in the Inventory, including Item types and their quantities
Get all equipment from Inventory: Returns all Equipment in the Inventory; the output parameter is a list of all Equipment IDs
Get Loot Component Item Quantity: Returns the quantity of Items with the specified Config ID from the Loot Component on the Loot Prefab
Get Loot Component Currency Quantity: Returns the amount of Currency with the specified Config ID from the Loot Component on the Loot Prefab
Get All Equipment from Loot Component: Returns all Equipment from the Loot Component on the Loot Prefab
Get All Items from Loot Component: Returns all Items from the Loot Component on the Loot Prefab
Get All Currency from Loot Component: Returns all Currencies from the Loot Component on the Loot Prefab
Get All Entities Within the Collision Tr: Returns all Entities within the Collision Trigger corresponding to a specific ID in the Collision Trigger Component on the Target Entity
Query Specified Mini-Map Marker Informat: Searches the information of the Mini-map Marker with the specified ID in the Mini-map Marker Component on the Target Entity
The Mini-map Marker ID to search
The active state of the searched Mini-map Marker
List of Players With Visible Markers
Returns the list of Players who can see this Marker
Returns the list of Players tracking this Marker
Get Entity's Mini-Map Marker Status: Searches the configuration and activation status of the Entity's current Mini-map Marker
Complete list of Mini-map Marker IDs for this Entity
Complete list of active Mini-map Marker IDs for this Entity
Complete list of inactive Mini-map Marker IDs for this Entity
Get Current Creation's Patrol Template: Returns the Patrol Template information of the specified Creation Entity
The Patrol Template ID currently active on this Creation
The Path ID referenced by the Creation's currently active Patrol Template
The Waypoint ID the Creation will move to next
Query If Achievement Is Completed: Searches whether the Achievement corresponding to a specific ID on the Target Entity is complete
Get the Currently Active Scan Tag Config: Returns the Configuration ID of the currently active Scan Tags on the Target Entity
Get Player Rank Score Change: Returns the Rank change score for the Player Entity under different Settlement states
Get Currently Active Entity Deployment G: Searches the list of Entity Layout Groups currently active in the Stage
Query Corresponding Gift Box Quantity: Searches the quantity of the specified Gift Box on the Player Entity
Query Corresponding Gift Box Consumption: Searches the consumed quantity of the specified Gift Box on the Player Entity
Get the Preset Status Value of the Compl: Get the preset status value of the complex creation
Enumerations Equal: After confirming the Enumeration type, determines whether the two input values are equal
Output True if equal, False if not equal
Assembly List: Assembles multiple Input Parameters of the same type (up to 100) into a single List
Assembles up to 100 parameters into a list
Equal: Determines whether two inputs are equal Some Parameter Types have special comparison rules: Floating Point Numbers: Floating Point Numbers are compared using approximate equality. When the difference between two Floating Point Numbers is less than an extremely small value, the two numbers are considered equal. For example: 2.0000001 and 2.0 are considered equal 3D Vector: The x, y, and z components of a 3D Vector are compared using Floating Point approximate equality
Output True if equal, False if not equal
Data Type Conversion: Converts input parameter types to another type for output. For specific rules, see Basic Concepts - [Conversion Rules Between Basic Data Types]
Split 3D Vector: Outputs the x, y, and z components of a 3D Vector as three Floating Point Numbers
Multiplication: Performs multiplication, supporting Floating Point and Integer multiplication
Division: Performs division, supporting Floating Point division and Integer division. Integer division returns the quotient result The divisor should not be 0, otherwise it may return an illegal value When the divisor is 0, the result is 0. -2147483648 divided by -1 results in 0.
Create 3D Vector: Creates a 3D Vector from x, y, and z components
Logarithm Operation: Calculates the logarithm of the argument with the specified base The base should not be negative or equal to 1, and the argument should not be negative, otherwise illegal values may be generated
Arccosine Function: Calculates the arccosine of the input and returns the value in radians
Arctangent Function: Calculates the arctangent of the input and returns the value in radians
Arcsine Function: Calculates the arcsine of the input and returns the value in radians
Range Limiting Operation:
Clamps the input value to the range [lower limit, upper limit] (both bounds inclusive) and outputs the result
* If the input falls within [lower limit, upper limit], returns the original value
*If the input is below the lower limit, returns the lower limit; if it exceeds the upper limit, returns the upper limit
*If the lower limit is greater than the upper limit, treats the input as invalid and returns an illegal value
Direction Vector to Rotation: Converts the Forward Vector and Upward Vector to Euler Angles
Represents the desired Orientation of the Unit
Defines the Unit's Up direction (used to determine the rotation angle). Default is the positive Y-axis of the World Coordinate System
Calculate Timestamp From Formatted Time: Converts a formatted time to a timestamp
Calculate Formatted Time From Timestamp: Converts a timestamp to formatted time
Calculate Day of the Week From Timestamp: Converts a timestamp to the day of the week
Addition: Adds two Floating Point Numbers or Integers
Subtraction: Subtracts two Floating Point Numbers or Integers
Take Larger Value: Returns the larger of two inputs
Take Smaller Value: Returns the smaller of two inputs
Absolute Value Operation: Returns the absolute value of the input
Distance Between Two Coordinate Points: Calculates the Euclidean distance between two coordinates
Logical NOT Operation: Performs a logical NOT operation on the input Boolean value and returns the result
Logical OR Operation: Performs a logical OR operation on the two input Boolean values and returns the result
Logical XOR Operation: Performs a logical XOR operation on the two input Boolean values and returns the result
Logical AND Operation: Performs a logical AND operation on the two input Boolean values and returns the result
Exponentiation: Raises the base to the given exponent and returns the result
Modulo Operation: Returns the modulus of Input 2 and Input 1
Arithmetic Square Root Operation: Returns the arithmetic square root of the input value
Sign Operation: When the input is positive, returns 1 When the input is negative, returns -1 When the input is 0, returns 0
Round to Integer Operation: Performs a rounding operation based on the rounding method and returns the rounded positive number

Round: Rounds to the nearest integer according to standard rulesRound Up: Returns the smallest integer greater than the input value. For example: input 1.2 → 2; input −2.3 → −2Round Down: Returns the largest integer smaller than the input value. For example: input 1.2 → 1; input −2.3 → −3Truncate: Removes the decimal part of the floating point number (rounds toward zero). For example: input 1.2 → 1; input −2.3 → −2
3D Vector Normalization: Normalizes the length of a 3D Vector and outputs the result
3D Vector Addition: Calculates the sum of two 3D Vectors
3D Vector Angle: Calculates the angle between two 3D Vectors and outputs it in radians
3D Vector Subtraction: Calculates the difference of two 3D Vectors
3D Vector Modulo Operation: Calculates the magnitude of the input 3D Vector
3D Vector Dot Product: Calculates the dot product of two input 3D Vectors
3D Vector Zoom: Scales the input 3D Vector (scalar multiplication) and outputs the result
3D Vector Cross Product: Calculates the cross product of two 3D Vectors
3D Vector Rotation: Rotates the input 3D Vector by the Euler Angles specified by the rotation and returns the result
This 3D input vector represents a specific rotation in Euler angles
Greater Than: Returns whether the left value is greater than the right value
Greater Than or Equal To: Returns whether the left value is greater than or equal to the right value
Less Than: Returns whether the left value is less than the right value
Less Than or Equal To: Returns whether the left value is less than or equal to the right value
Cosine Function: Calculates the cosine of the input in radians
Tangent Function: Calculates the tangent of the input in radians
Sine Function: Calculates the sine of the input in radians
Left Shift Operation: Performs a logical left shift on the input by the specified bit count and outputs the result
Right Shift Operation: Performs a logical right shift on the input by the specified bit count and outputs the result Performs an arithmetic right shift, preserving the sign bit
Bitwise AND: Performs a bitwise AND operation on the two inputs and returns the result
Bitwise OR: Performs a bitwise OR operation on the two inputs and returns the result
XOR (Exclusive OR): Performs a bitwise XOR operation on the two inputs and returns the result
Bitwise Complement: Performs a bitwise complement operation on the input and returns the result
Write by bit: Writes the write value as a binary number to the [start bit, end bit] of the target value (also a binary number). The start bit is indexed from 0, and the write length includes both the start and end bits If the binary significant length of the write value (counted from the first 1 from the left) exceeds the write length, the write fails and returns the original value If the write value is negative, it also fails due to exceeding the write length (the first bit of a negative number's binary representation is the sign bit 1)
Read by bit: Reads the value from [start bit, end bit] of the value (in binary representation)
Create Dictionary: Creates Key-Value Pairs sequentially from the input key and value lists This node builds the Dictionary using the shorter of the key and value lists; extra items are truncated If duplicate keys are found in the key list, creation fails and returns an empty Dictionary
Assembly Dictionary: Combines up to 50 Key-Value Pairs into one Dictionary
Split Structure: Returns all parameters of the specified Structure
Assemble Structure: Combines multiple parameters into a single Structure-type value
